intro: Impatiens irangiensis, commonly known as the Eastern Himalayan Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
